attributes.additional_details: If you are unvaccinated domestically, you will not legally have to self-isolate. However, if you are unvaccinated travelling in to the UK you must take 2 tests and self-isolate if you test positive. This is discriminatory. If you are in the UK 'track and trace' will come to an end. If you are travelling in to the UK, you will be tracked by a locator form. Again, this is discriminatory. The Government says it trusts the public to exercise personal responsibility, this must apply to travel too.
attributes.background: Following the welcome removal of all domestic COVID restrictions, we call on the Government to remove all international travel restrictions (including testing and locator forms).

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605858
